meanings.definition: To remove spiritual qualities or significance from something.
meanings.sent1: The factory's modern design despiritualizes the once serene landscape.
meanings.sent2: The new technology despiritualizes the traditional ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The robot's dance despiritualizes the art of ballet.
meanings.sent4: The bright lights despiritualize the night sky, hiding the stars' beauty.
meanings.sent5: The noisy construction despiritualizes the peaceful neighborhood.

meanings.definition: To make something less spiritual or sacred.
meanings.sent1: The commercialization of the holiday despiritualizes its true meaning.
meanings.sent2: The graffiti despiritualizes the ancient temple walls.
meanings.sent3: The prankster's antics despiritualize the solemn atmosphere of the church.
meanings.sent4: The gossip despiritualizes the bond of trust between friends.
meanings.sent5: The pollution despiritualizes the purity of the natural spring.
